DataElement.preferredName: Findings About Events or Interventions Domain Dual X-ray Absorptiometry Bone Mineral Density Test Outcome Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The bone mineral density score obtained from a Dual X-ray Absorptiometry (DEXA) scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Findings About Events or Interventions Domain Dual X-ray Absorptiometry Bone Mineral Density Test Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to findings about events or interventions._A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured._A scanning procedure used to measure calcium and other minerals present in bone._The result of an action.

Property.preferredName: Dual X-ray Absorptiometry Bone Mineral Density Test Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured.:A scanning procedure used to measure calcium and other minerals present in bone.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured.
A scanning procedure used to measure calcium and other minerals present in bone.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
